solution.text:
By observing the figure, clearly we can see that top 2 portions are segment corresponding to the chords AB and AC
For both the segments angle subtended at the centre = 90\(^\circ\) and radius=R
We draw a line from O to AC , let's say it intersects at T
Now area (top right segment)\(=\pi \times R^2\times \frac {\theta}{360}-area(OAC)\)
Similarly, area(top left segment)\(=\pi \times R^2\times \frac {\theta}{360}-area(OAB)\)
area of both segments= \(2\times [\pi \times R^2\times \frac {90}{360}]-[area(OAB)+area(OAC)\)
area of both segments=\( 2\times _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/4,2)}}_-[area(ABC)\)
\(_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*2,2)}}_-[\frac 12 \times (2R) \times R]\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*j*2*j-(j*j),2)}}_\)
Area of the shaded region in the bottom half= area (sector corresponding to chord BC) - area \(\bigtriangleup \) CBD
area (sector corresponding to chord BC)=\(\frac 12 \times \pi R^2=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/2,2)}}_\)
For area of\(\bigtriangleup\) BCD we know perpendicular from point D on BC is \(\frac R2 \Rightarrow OD=_{{Decimal('0.5')*j}}_\)
We have BC=diameter=2R
area of\(\bigtriangleup BCD =\frac 12 \times (2R) \times \frac {R}2\)
\(\Rightarrow area \bigtriangleup = _{{Decimal('0.5')*j*j}}_\)
Area of the shaded region in the bottom half= \(_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/2,2)}}_ - _{{Decimal('0.5')*j*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow bottom\,area=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/2-Decimal('0.5')*j*j,2)}}_\)
Area of the complete shaded region=Area of the top 2 segments + area (shaded region in the bottom half)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*j*2*j-(j*j),2)}}_+_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/2-Decimal('0.5')*j*j,2)}}_\)
Shaded region \(=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*2*j-(j*j)+pi_val*j*j/2-Decimal('0.5')*j*j,2)}}_\)
